alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Gilmer; Lewis (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:23AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Doddridge, northeastern Gilmer and central Lewis Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 123 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glenville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weston, Glenville, Stonewall Jackson, Sand Fork, Camden, Baldwin, Sand Run, Leopold, Troy, Walkersville, Alum Bridge, Coxs Mills, Linn and Horner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 83 and 99. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
